bonito,poca duracion,precio alto,temperatura insatisfactoria,baja lubricacion,cuchillas afiladas
review_list.body: pensaba en alta expectativa este producto,ya que es el producto mas avanzado de gillette,pero la durabilidad de el calentado no dura mucho tiempo,principalmente porque yo lo utilizo para afeitarme el cuerpo una vez al mes(a final de mes,el fin de semana, viernes o sabado,o la semana antes de terminar dicho mes,dependiendo el mes)bueno...el caso es que el precio en mi pais es considerado muy alto por el cambio de Dolares a COP,la lubricacion se gasto al primer uso,la temperatura en alto me parece poco satisfactorio aunque si eligieron hasta esa temperatura para cuidar la piel no me quejo,la cuchillas son afiladas puede que mas suaves que la gillette 5 hojas con flexball(ya que este me cortaba, en vambio este modelo no)el diseño es bonito,mi recomendacion: yo personalmente lo dejaria en mi coleccion de afeitadoras gillette de 5 hojas o 7 hojas(dorco),o lo podrias regalar a alguien que si lo necesite,ya que es una afeitadora que sirve y dura lo suficiente para afeitarse la cara,la nariz y el cuello o zonas pequeñas(intimas como: axilas,pene/vagina,ano/el culo,) o los pelos de las manos/pies, aunque repito,no esta hecha para afeitarte todo el cuerpo y si quieres afeitarte apenas las zonas pequeñas la duracion te puede jugar en contra(por eso personalmente digo que esta hecha solo para la cara), recomendaria comprar la gillette labs con exfoliante ya que no te tienes que preocupar por la bateria,el exfoliante ayuda a eliminar las celulas muertas,hay mas ediciones limitadas que podrian gustarte,es reciclable y bueno con el medio ambiente(ya depende de ti botar la afeitadora cuando se acabe el exfoliante) si no quieres gastar tu dinero y estas limitado o te afeitas zonas pequeñas como mencione antes, con una afeitadora de cartucho y el resto del cuerpo con una electrica, entonces comprate la heathed razor, tambien puedes si vives en un clima frio, si como dije estas limitado de dinero,te gusta utilizar una afeitadora de cartucho para todo o quieres cuidar mas o menos el medio ambiente sin gastar en tecnologia que puede no utilices y gastes el doble de tu dinero comprando, y en materiales tecnologicos utiles para otras cosas que puede y terminen en la basura entonces comprate la de exfoliante, lo mejor que tiene gillette,con algo que es bueno con el ambiente,si eres de los que quieren afeitarse la cabeza puede que te sirva la heathed razor aunque te recomendaria utilizar una maquina electrica, bueno... como dije ya depende de ti que quieres y como quieres sacar provecho del producto(aunque, mi recomendacion es que pienses bien y sepas comprar inteligentemente ante todo lo que tus necesidades necesitan)PD: gracias por leer y perdon por hacerlos leer mucho,no se hacer reseñas y trato de explicar lo mejor que puedo para todo tipo de personas que lo lean, espero les haya servido...

review_list.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Warning ! Don't buy this product !!
review_list.body: Two years ago, in November 2021, I got a “Bugatti” Gillette heated razor for my birthday from my son. I was very pleased with the device, but unfortunately the device battery system failed in June 2022, after using it for only 6 months.Since this was within the warranty so Gillette was kind enough to send me a replacement immediately. Much to my disappointment this device had the same problem after 10 months, again within the warranty of the replacement device.Gillette was very kind to again immediately send a replacement. Regrettably, this replacement device’s battery was “dead on arrival”. I was requested to send the defect devices to the Gillette Repair center. Supposedly to verify that the devices were indeed defect. I received again new device in August 2023. But today, December 15 2023, the razor failed again after only 5 months.So that were 4 defect devices in two years. Obviously, Gillette has some serious quality problems. Please don’t buy this product, you will be very disappointed.

review_list.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
An honest review here…
review_list.body: So I’m 48, and I’ve used everything from different electric razors/shavers, to straight edge, to disposable, two blade, three, four, five etc.I tend to stick with Gillette products even though I know you pay a premium for them. I was hesitant to try this razor but not at that exorbitant price of $200+! I waited til it came down to $112,(although it’s probably worth no more than $50 tops.) I will say it’s really easy to use, charge, and switch temperatures on the blade.I used it for the first time in my shower, with shave cream, and got a really nice, smooth shave with zero irritation. The warm blade felt nice against the skin. Now, I’ve read plenty of comments of “why not just run your razor under hot water instead?” Go ahead, and you’ll have to do that over and over again! It’s not going to continuously give the same feeling as the heated bar below the razor.Now, am I looking forward to paying a premium for replacement blades, no. Here’s the thing though, I can stretch the life span out because I have different razors, and a few electric ones. I like to switch it up from time to time lol!Bottom line is it’s not as bad as all the whiny reviews I’ve read, but it’s not for everyone either. It would be better priced around $50, but so far I do like it. You be the judge.Update: I’m one month into using this razor now, 6 or 7 shaves all in the shower. Before I had to thoroughly wet my face with hot water to keep from the razor tugging my hair as I shave, but not with this razor. As soon as I apply shave cream and turn the heating element on, I’m shaving tug free within 3-4 seconds. The heating element feels nice against the skin, and I really do get a nice, smooth shave. The top blue strip on the razor blade is starting to wear away some, but I’m still getting a good shave from the initial blade.Will update again if things change.UPDATE 2:Razor handle quit charging on 4-18, not even 6 months into using it.I contacted Gillette via the chat feature on their webpage, had to provide proof of purchase through Amazon, and a few days later received a new kit in the mail.The short life of the charging handle does worry me some, but at least Gillette stood behind their product, and gave me a hassle free replacement.Will update again if need be.

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Worth the price
review_list.body: This is the first personal care item I have ever bought where I felt I splurged on myself.  I read about the Gillette Labs razor and heard how good it was, and then stumbled across the heated razor I could get as well.  It was expensive, but I waited and before Black Friday it went on sale with a big price drop.  Even so, it was about six times more expensive than the ordinary Gillette razors.I usually shave in the shower using women's shave oil, which you can find online or in a big box store (the women's oils have many different smells and the bottle is significantly bigger than the oil drops I used to use).  I wait until I have been in there a bit and my face warms up, and then the shave is smooth and easy.  This razor claims to heat your face like they do when you get a barbershop shave, but they say a lot.  I started working out and wanted to shave, but not shower at home until after my workout, which meant shaving with a cold face, and trying to warm up the blade in a sink of hot water.I used this new razor this morning.  It was set to the hottest setting and holy buckets, the shave was amazingly comfortable.  It heats in less than one second and it gets warm.  It really does feel like a hot towel barber shave and I thought I got just as good a shave, if not better because it felt luxurious, than the other Gillette I use in the shower.  It is amazing.  This razor was well worth the money I spent on it.  The only down-side is that I probably wont be able to buy the blade refills at my local big box membership store.  Alas.

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
A Luxury Shave If You Can Factor In a Total Replacement Every 2-3 Years
review_list.body: TL;DR: The Gillette Labs Heated Razor Gold Edition isn't a gimmick. It's a meticulously engineered shaving experience that leverages thermodynamics to deliver an unparalleled shave. But at a premium price, you can expect the razor to last 2-3 years before needing a total replacement.First Impressions: The Gold Edition oozes luxury. The weighty, gold-trimmed handle feels substantial, while the inductive charging dock screams sophistication. But the true star is the heated blade cartridge. Gillette's micro-heater tech raises the temperature to a precise 122°F in 0.5 seconds.The Shave: Ah, the shave itself. It's like a warm hug on your face. The heated blade glides effortlessly, prepping hair for the five-blade onslaught. Gone are the days of pre-shave oil—the warmth acts as a lubricant, minimizing friction and irritation. The result? It was a shockingly close shave with minimal razor burn, even on my notoriously sensitive skin.Tech Talk: This razor is a marvel of miniaturization. The lithium-ion battery tucked within the handle powers the heater for up to six shaves while the temperature sensors constantly monitor and adjust heat output for optimal comfort and safety.But it could be better. The hefty price tag might sting, and the proprietary blade cartridges add to the long-term cost. Plus, the temperature range is limited, and some might miss the ritual of a hot shower shave.Verdict: The Gillette Labs Heated Razor Gold Edition is a game-changer. It's not just a razor; it's an investment in a luxurious, comfortable, and technically impressive shaving experience.

When I opened the box and looked at the Bugatti, I thought that it would nick my face like crazy. Anyway I lathered up and began shaving. Oh boy!  Was I surprised at how smooth and nick free of a shave I got from it. This is my number one favorite razor to go to. Thank you Amazon, and thank you Gillette for finally inventing a razor that shaves without giving your face nicks

review_list.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Great Razor but there are Issues
review_list.body: I love the shave with the heat.  The blades are surgically sharp for the first 4 or 5 uses.  They drop down a little in sharpness but then seem to stay at that level for months so you can either change them every week or two to three times per year.  Now the problem.  I've had 4 of these.  With daily use the battery fails after 13 or 14 months.  Gillette will not offer an exchange or sell you just the razor without the expensive packaging and charger.  They may offer a slight discount but it's the same as their occasional sale price.  This applies to both the Bugatti edition and the regular.  No one appears to have figured out how to open the handle to change the battery.  I have 3 failed units.  I tried heat and solvent to open the first one with no luck.  Next I'm going to try to saw one open.Gillette needs to either fix their charge circuit that is destroying the battery or offer to exchange the razor at some reasonable cost, maybe $45 after the 12 month warranty.

review_list.body: pensaba en alta expectativa este producto,ya que es el producto mas avanzado de gillette,pero la durabilidad de el calentado no dura mucho tiempo,principalmente porque yo lo utilizo para afeitarme el cuerpo una vez al mes(a final de mes,el fin de semana, viernes o sabado,o la semana antes de terminar dicho mes,dependiendo el mes)bueno...el caso es que el precio en mi pais es considerado muy alto por el cambio de Dolares a COP,la lubricacion se gasto al primer uso,la temperatura en alto me parece poco satisfactorio aunque si eligieron hasta esa temperatura para cuidar la para afeitarse la cara,la nariz y el cuello o zonas pequeñas(intimas como: axilas,pene/vagina,ano/el culo,) o los pelos de las manos/pies, aunque repito,no esta hecha para afeitarte todo el cuerpo y si quieres afeitarte apenas las zonas pequeñas la duracion te puede jugar en contra(por eso personalmente digo que esta hecha solo para la cara), recomendaria comprar la gillette labs con exfoliante depende de ti botar la afeitadora cuando se acabe el exfoliante) si no quieres gastar tu dinero y estas limitado o te afeitas zonas pequeñas como mencione antes, con una afeitadora de cartucho y el resto del cuerpo con una electrica, entonces comprate la heathed razor, tambien puedes si vives en un clima frio, si como dije estas limitado de dinero,te gusta utilizar una afeitadora de cartucho para todo o quieres cuidar mas o menos el medio ambiente sin gastar en tecnologia que puede no utilices y gastes el doble de tu dinero comprando, y en materiales tecnologicos utiles para otras cosas que puede y terminen en la basura entonces comprate la de exfoliante, lo mejor que tiene gillette,con algo que es bueno con el ambiente,si eres de los que quieren afeitarse la cabeza puede que te sirva la heathed razor aunque te recomendaria utilizar una maquina electrica, bueno... como dije ya depende de ti que quieres y como quieres sacar provecho del producto(aunque, mi recomendacion es que pienses bien y sepas comprar inteligentemente ante todo lo que tus necesidades necesitan)PD: gracias por leer y perdon por hacerlos leer mucho,no se hacer reseñas y trato de explicar lo mejor que The base lights up when you place the razor in the stand, however, does not continue charging. When you turn the heat feature on, the razor blinks orange rapidly, however, it does not stay on. We tried multiple electrical outlets to ensure there was power. This was an expensive razor for 4 months use, not including the blades. Unless Gillette rectifies this, I would strongly encourage others not to purchase this. I am only now reading that other consumers are experiencing the same issue.

I tried one of the original labs handles with the heavier base kind of looked a little bit cooler than the standard one and I liked it I did notice that they didn't have one with the vibration mode I added this one to my cart once I saw the heating which I thought was a nifty niche thing and when they lowered the price for a prime day I'd completely jumped on it I have to say that I know you're thinking why would I need it to warm itself if I'm ultimately going to rinse it in hot water and it warms up the blades anyway cuz that's what I said this is all true and it does have still happen however if you shaved for many years like I have you noticed that after a couple of swipes with the water making the blades hot it completely wears off this thing keeps going and I say it is definitely notable I left mine on the highest setting it didn't get to the point where I needed to feel like I needed to lower it so it was a good heat on the high mode I don't think I'll ever be going down from there it does work great so far and if I come to a point where I don't feel the same way I will come and update this cuz I'm very intimate about razors and this one seems pretty good so far I am going to miss the vibration mode that the older versions had I wish it could incorporate both the heating and the vibration into one now that would be cool but I think I'd rather the heat over the vibration which is weird I didn't think I would.

review_list.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
An honest review here…
review_list.body: So I’m 48, and I’ve used everything from different electric razors/shavers, to straight edge, to disposable, two blade, three, four, five etc.I tend to stick with Gillette products even though I know you pay a premium for them. I was hesitant to try this razor but not at that exorbitant price of $200+! I waited til it came down to $112,(although it’s probably worth no more than $50 tops.) I will say it’s really easy to use, charge, and switch temperatures on the blade.I used it for the first time in my shower, with shave cream, and got a really nice, smooth shave with zero irritation. The warm blade felt nice against the skin. Now, I’ve read plenty of comments of “why not just run your razor under hot water instead?” Go ahead, and you’ll have to do that over and over again! It’s not going to continuously give the same feeling as the heated bar below the razor.Now, am I looking forward to paying a premium for replacement blades, no. Here’s the thing though, I can stretch the life span out because I have different razors, and a few electric ones. I like to switch it up from time to time lol!Bottom line is it’s not as bad as all the whiny reviews I’ve read, but it’s not for everyone either. It would be better priced around $50, but so far I do like it. You be the judge.Update: I’m one month into using this razor now, 6 or 7 shaves all in the shower. Before I had to thoroughly wet my face with hot water to keep from the razor tugging my hair as I shave, but not with this razor. As soon as I apply shave cream and turn the heating element on, I’m shaving tug free within 3-4 seconds. The heating element feels nice against the skin, and I really do get a nice, smooth shave. The top blue strip on the razor blade is starting to wear away some, but I’m still getting a good shave from the initial blade.Will update again if things change.UPDATE 2:Razor handle quit charging on 4-18, not even 6 months into using it.I contacted Gillette via the chat feature on their webpage, had to provide proof of purchase through Amazon, and a few days later received a new kit in the mail.The short life of the charging handle does worry me some, but at least Gillette stood behind their product, and gave me a hassle free replacement.Will update again if need be.

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Worth the price
review_list.body: This is the first personal care item I have ever bought where I felt I splurged on myself.  I read about the Gillette Labs razor and heard how good it was, and then stumbled across the heated razor I could get as well.  It was expensive, but I waited and before Black Friday it went on sale with a big price drop.  Even so, it was about six times more expensive than the ordinary Gillette razors.I usually shave in the shower using women's shave oil, which you can find online or in a big box store (the women's oils have many different smells and the bottle is significantly bigger than the oil drops I used to use).  I wait until I have been in there a bit and my face warms up, and then the shave is smooth and easy.  This razor claims to heat your face like they do when you get a barbershop shave, but they say a lot.  I started working out and wanted to shave, but not shower at home until after my workout, which meant shaving with a cold face, and trying to warm up the blade in a sink of hot water.I used this new razor this morning.  It was set to the hottest setting and holy buckets, the shave was amazingly comfortable.  It heats in less than one second and it gets warm.  It really does feel like a hot towel barber shave and I thought I got just as good a shave, if not better because it felt luxurious, than the other Gillette I use in the shower.  It is amazing.  This razor was well worth the money I spent on it.  The only down-side is that I probably wont be able to buy the blade refills at my local big box membership store.  Alas.

I have a sensitive face and tough beard. I was trying different razors to find one that was good for my face. When I opened the box and looked at the Bugatti, I thought that it would nick my face like crazy. Anyway I lathered up and began shaving. Oh boy!  Was I surprised at how smooth and nick free of a shave I got from it. This is my number one favorite razor to go to. Thank you Amazon, and thank you Gillette for finally inventing a razor that shaves without giving your face nicks

review_list.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Great Razor but there are Issues
review_list.body: I love the shave with the heat.  The blades are surgically sharp for the first 4 or 5 uses.  They drop down a little in sharpness but then seem to stay at that level for months so you can either change them every week or two to three times per year.  Now the problem.  I've had 4 of these.  With daily use the battery fails after 13 or 14 months.  Gillette will not offer an exchange or sell you just the razor without the expensive packaging and charger.  They may offer a slight discount but it's the same as their occasional sale price.  This applies to both the Bugatti edition and the regular.  No one appears to have figured out how to open the handle to change the battery.  I have 3 failed units.  I tried heat and solvent to open the first one with no luck.  Next I'm going to try to saw one open.Gillette needs to either fix their charge circuit that is destroying the battery or offer to exchange the razor at some reasonable cost, maybe $45 after the 12 month warranty.

para afeitarme el cuerpo una vez al mes(a final de mes,el fin de semana, viernes o sabado,o la semana antes de terminar dicho mes,dependiendo el mes)bueno...el caso es que el precio en mi pais es considerado muy alto por el cambio de Dolares a COP,la lubricacion se gasto al primer uso,la temperatura en alto me parece poco satisfactorio aunque si eligieron hasta esa temperatura para cuidar la piel no me quejo,la cuchillas son afiladas puede que mas suaves que la gillette 5 hojas con flexball(ya que este me cortaba, en vambio este modelo no)el diseño es bonito,mi recomendacion: yo personalmente lo dejaria en mi coleccion de afeitadoras gillette de 5 hojas o 7 hojas(dorco),o lo podrias regalar a alguien que si lo necesite,ya que es una afeitadora que sirve y dura lo suficiente para afeitarse la cara,la nariz y el cuello o zonas pequeñas(intimas como: axilas,pene/vagina,ano/el culo,) o los pelos de las manos/pies, aunque repito,no esta hecha para afeitarte todo el cuerpo y I tried one of the original labs handles with the heavier base kind of looked a little bit cooler than the standard one and I liked it I did notice that they didn't have one with the vibration mode I added this one to my cart once I saw the heating which I thought was a nifty niche thing and when they lowered the price for a prime day I'd completely jumped on it I have to say that I know you're thinking why would I need it to warm itself if I'm ultimately going to rinse it in hot water and it warms up the blades anyway cuz that's what I said this is all true and it does have still happen however if you shaved for many years like I have you noticed that after a couple of swipes with the water making the blades hot it completely wears off this thing keeps going and I say it is definitely notable I left mine on the highest setting it didn't get to the point where I needed to feel like I needed to lower it so it was a good heat on the high mode I don't think I'll ever be going down from there it does work great so far and if I come to a point where I don't feel the same way I will come and update this cuz I'm very intimate about razors and this one seems pretty good so far I am going to miss the vibration mode that the older versions had I wish it could incorporate both the heating and the vibration into one now that would be cool but I think I'd rather the heat over the vibration which is weird I didn't think I would.

Feels Great! Close Shave! 12-Month Lifespan
review_list.body: It's a great heated razor handle that I've purchased twice. Unfortunately, each time the unit only lasted about 12 months.

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Heated razor lasted 28 months
review_list.body: My wife gave me the Bugatti Limited Edition Gillette Heated Razor for Christmas 2021. This was my favorite gift, although I would have preferred the real Bugatti, LOL. I use it 6-days a week and only charge it when the battery totally runs down. The heated element finally quit on May 1, 2024. I love having this heated razor and will eventually replace it with a new one. Perhaps Gillette will send me a coupon?

review_list.title:
2.0 out of 5 stars
It’s excellent in design and materials on exterior. It’s just doesn’t work well!
review_list.body: Beautiful design and packaging high quality materials that you can feel it in your hand when you hold it or use it. The biggest problem is that the battery doesn’t hold charge at all, fully charge the blade holder and the stand which also hold charge to charge the blade after each use but both batteries fully charged and just let them sit for a week and no charge!!! So beside it’s look and design  it doesn’t really deliver a better warm shaving, at this price it’s unacceptable ( regular ones are much cheaper but you just pay 35%ish more to get the Bugatti,It doesn’t provide a warm smoother experience but if you’re slow it’ll burn your face ( yes it gets a little too hot not warm, quality design look everything excellent, Battery always 🪫, even a 🔋 fully charged battery will die in a week or so JUST SITTING NOT USE IT, and battery won’t hold charge. Not a good thing when you pay hundreds extra to get a unique shaving experience then you find out it wasn’t what you were expecting.Second appointment

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Love it !
review_list.body: Ever since I started using the Gillette heated razors I can’t live without it. I bought the first one from Best Buy and it lasted almost two years. I had the total tech product protection which covers the item for two years. They didn’t sell it anymore so refunded my money and I got the Bugatti edition on sale here. Like the looks of it. Does the same job but if you can get a deal on the Bugatti one it’s nicer looking.

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
LOVE LOVE LOVE this for bald men!
review_list.body: I purchased this heated razor as a present for a friend who is bald, and he's absolutely thrilled with it. It has revolutionized his shaving experience. Previously, he only used regular razors, explaining that electric shavers didn't provide a close enough cut. But from his first use of this heated razor, he was incredibly impressed. He mentioned how the warmth felt like a hot towel, with the heat emanating from the handle rather than the blade. He's also very pleased with the closeness of the shave it provides. This razor has positively transformed his daily routine, making it an enjoyable experience.

review_list.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
It is okay.
review_list.body: The Gillette Heated Razor is the definition of not really worth it. The price is way off, doesn't really get too hot (understandably), and a little bit clunky compared to other razors. The cool thing about it is that it has a magnetic stand that charges the razor and the look of the razor is really cool. To know that it heats up and gives you a warm fuzzy feeling inside is not really justifiable since overall it is really just a regular razor with a heating strip. The same razor without the heating strip, but exfoliating bar is on sale now and is worth the price more than this one. I still get razor bumps even while using the thickest shaving cream I could find, and yeah just not worth it.

Amazing close shave and the heat felt great on my skin.  Would definitely recommend to anyway who likes a close shave and a little extra luxury!

The price point isn’t too much different than this brand’s standard razors, and I personally think it’s worth it.

Maybe I'm just trying to validate spending this much on a razor, but the heating element makes a difference. I noticed that the blades are really nice too. Hopefully it stands the test of time.

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars

review_list.body: This razor delivers the best shave I’ve ever experienced. The blades don’t clog like so many others do. The heat feature is very soothing and I love it. Yes, is costly, but in my opinion it’s worth it. I have the non heated model, which I bought first, but it’s not near as comfortable to shave with. I also like the cool blue color.

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
The heat bar is a game changer!
review_list.body: The razor holds a good charge over a long period of time. The system provides a well heated warming bar right before the razor to allow for a closer, cleaner shave. This is my second heated razor (this time I went with the Bugatti for fun), and they both work wonderfully. Complete with a charging stand and optional charging case for when you travel.

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars

review_list.body: At first I was skeptical about, what I thought was a gimmick.  Now that I have used it for awhile I have to say it is amazing. I actually use it in the shower and it is nothing short of a miracle for me.  It shaves very close and I do not get the razor bumps I got before.  The charge really lasts for 6 shaves and it is absolutely the best shave I have ever gotten with a razor.  It was worth every penny but I wish the cartridges were not $6+ each.

review_list.title:

I get a good clean-close shave with it but I also get just as good a shave with my Harrys razor at a fraction of the cost.

Ive been using the same blade for a month and my face is as smooth as a babys bottom.  Long slow strokes pressing the warm bar against your face as you go slowwwlyy. Feel its warmth, and shave like a guy who owns a bugatti.  Luxuriously.  Seriously tho, once you get it you get it and the blades are top notch, but shaving like a disposable in a public restroom yeah I can see where people aren’t getting the desired effect.  Slow down and enjoy some of the finer things in life.  I mean you did pay for it.

It does not get super hot to where it could burn you, but it heats up plenty in seconds. The razor handle feels solid in my hand and everything is top quality. I read about the Gillette Labs razor and heard how good it was, and then stumbled across the heated razor I could get as well.  It was expensive, but I waited and before Black Friday it went on sale with a big price drop.  Even so, it was about six times more expensive than the ordinary Gillette razors.I usually shave in the shower using women's shave oil, which you can find online or in a big box store (the women's oils have many different smells and the bottle is significantly bigger than the oil drops I used to use).  I wait until I have been in there a bit and my face warms up, and then the shave is smooth and easy.  This razor claims to heat your face like they do when you get a barbershop shave, but they say a lot.  I started working out and wanted to shave, but not shower at home until after my workout, which meant shaving with a cold face, and trying to warm up the blade in a sink of hot water.I used this new razor this morning.  It was set to the hottest setting and holy buckets, the shave was amazingly comfortable.  It heats in less than one second and it gets warm.  It really does feel like a hot towel barber shave and I thought I got just as good a shave, if not better because it felt luxurious, than the other Gillette I use in the shower.  It is amazing.  This razor was well worth the money I spent on it.  The only down-side is that I probably wont be able to buy the blade refills at my local big box membership store.  Alas.

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
A Luxury Shave If You Can Factor In a Total Replacement Every 2-3 Years
review_list.body: TL;DR: The Gillette Labs Heated Razor Gold Edition isn't a gimmick. It's a meticulously engineered shaving experience that leverages thermodynamics to deliver an unparalleled shave. But at a premium price, you can expect the razor to last 2-3 years before needing a total replacement.First Impressions: The Gold Edition oozes luxury. The weighty, gold-trimmed handle feels substantial, while the inductive charging dock screams sophistication. But the true star is the heated blade cartridge. Gillette's micro-heater tech raises the temperature to a precise 122°F in 0.5 seconds.The Shave: Ah, the shave itself. It's like a warm hug on your face. The heated blade glides effortlessly, prepping hair for the five-blade onslaught. Gone are the days of pre-shave oil—the warmth acts as a lubricant, minimizing friction and irritation. The result? It was a shockingly close shave with minimal razor burn, even on my notoriously sensitive skin.Tech Talk: This razor is a marvel of miniaturization. The lithium-ion battery tucked within the handle powers the heater for up to six shaves while the temperature sensors constantly monitor and adjust heat output for optimal comfort and safety.But it could be better. The hefty price tag might sting, and the proprietary blade cartridges add to the long-term cost. Plus, the temperature range is limited, and some might miss the ritual of a hot shower shave.Verdict: The Gillette Labs Heated Razor Gold Edition is a game-changer. It's not just a razor; it's an investment in a luxurious, comfortable, and technically impressive shaving experience.

I have a sensitive face and tough beard. I was trying different razors to find one that was good for my face. When I opened the box and looked at the Bugatti, I thought that it would nick my face like crazy. Anyway I lathered up and began shaving. Oh boy!  Was I surprised at how smooth and nick free of a shave I got from it. This is my number one favorite razor to go to. Thank you Amazon, and thank you Gillette for finally inventing a razor that shaves without giving your face nicks

I have used many razors in my time, actually spending more on certain brands than this one, but I have to tell you, this was the most comfortable, accurate, smooth shave that I have ever had. I was astonished and greatly impressed. The razor cut through my 4 day beard like butter. The absolute closest, comfortable and easiest shave I have ever had. The price may be a little high for some but to get an excellent comfortable shave is worth every penny. Refills are a little pricey but if I can get 10 shaves with each blade, this is a home run for me. I would have liked a little hotter heat strip but that's just me.  THIS IS A WINNER IN MY BOOK !

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
The heated razor keeps my face extra smooth!
review_list.body: As a man who loves a good shave, I was excited to try out the Gillette Heated Razor for Men, Bugatti Limited Edition Shave Kit by GilletteLabs. Let me tell you, this thing is a game changer!First of all, the heated razor feels like a hot towel is being draped over your face, making for a luxurious shaving experience. It's like a spa day in your own bathroom! The razor is designed with the same attention to detail as a Bugatti car, and I feel like I'm driving a luxury vehicle on my face.The shave itself is smooth and effortless, thanks to the five blades that effortlessly glide over your skin. The razor even has a FlexDisc technology which adapts to the contours of your face, ensuring a comfortable and close shave every time.The only downside is that my wife keeps trying to steal it for herself! I guess it's not just for men after all.The Bugatti Limited Edition Shave Kit comes with everything you need for the perfect shave, including a magnetic charging dock, a travel case, and even a premium shaving cream. It's the ultimate shaving kit for the man who wants to look and feel his best.Overall, I would highly recommend the Gillette Heated Razor for Men, Bugatti Limited Edition Shave Kit by GilletteLabs to any man (or woman!) who wants to elevate their shaving experience to the next level. It's like having a spa day in your own bathroom, and who doesn't want that?

This is my second heated razor (this time I went with the Bugatti for fun), and they both work wonderfully. Complete with a charging stand and optional charging case for when you travel.

I actually use it in the shower and it is nothing short of a miracle for me.  It shaves very close and I do not get the razor bumps I got before.  The charge really lasts for 6 shaves and it is absolutely the best shave I have ever gotten with a razor.  It was worth every penny but I wish the cartridges were not $6+ each.

Ive been using the same blade for a month and my face is as smooth as a babys bottom.  Long slow strokes pressing the warm bar against your face as you go slowwwlyy. Feel its warmth, and shave like a guy who owns a bugatti.  Luxuriously.  Seriously tho, once you get it you get it and the blades are top notch, but shaving like a disposable in a public restroom yeah I can see where people aren’t getting the desired effect.  Slow down and enjoy some of the finer things in life.  I mean you did pay for it.

(If they could add vibration like some other razors, it might justify the price.) The warming bar feels great on my face and it gives me a close and comfortable shave. It does not get super hot to where it could burn you, but it heats up plenty in seconds. The razor handle feels solid in my hand and everything is top quality. My face and I wish I would have purchased this heated razor a long time ago…

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
This nRazor Is A Winner
review_list.body: Ordered the Gillette Bugatti, received it and charged it. I am semi retired and usually shave every other day but It was 4 days since my last shave, with more stubble so I was a little hesitant about it's ability. I lathered up and used the razor. I have used many razors in my time, actually spending more on certain brands than this one, but I have to tell you, this was the most comfortable, accurate, smooth shave that I have ever had. I was astonished and greatly impressed. The razor cut through my 4 day beard like butter. The absolute closest, comfortable and easiest shave I have ever had. The price may be a little high for some but to get an excellent comfortable shave is worth every penny. Refills are a little pricey but if I can get 10 shaves with each blade, this is a home run for me. I would have liked a little hotter heat strip but that's just me.  THIS IS A WINNER IN MY BOOK !

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
The heated razor keeps my face extra smooth!
review_list.body: As a man who loves a good shave, I was excited to try out the Gillette Heated Razor for Men, Bugatti Limited Edition Shave Kit by GilletteLabs. Let me tell you, this thing is a game changer!First of all, the heated razor feels like a hot towel is being draped over your face, making for a luxurious shaving experience. It's like a spa day in your own bathroom! The razor is designed with the same attention to detail as a Bugatti car, and I feel like I'm driving a luxury vehicle on my face.The shave itself is smooth and effortless, thanks to the five blades that effortlessly glide over your skin. The razor even has a FlexDisc technology which adapts to the contours of your face, ensuring a comfortable and close shave every time.The only downside is that my wife keeps trying to steal it for herself! I guess it's not just for men after all.The Bugatti Limited Edition Shave Kit comes with everything you need for the perfect shave, including a magnetic charging dock, a travel case, and even a premium shaving cream. It's the ultimate shaving kit for the man who wants to look and feel his best.Overall, I would highly recommend the Gillette Heated Razor for Men, Bugatti Limited Edition Shave Kit by GilletteLabs to any man (or woman!) who wants to elevate their shaving experience to the next level. It's like having a spa day in your own bathroom, and who doesn't want that?

eciN
review_list.body:
The media could not be loaded.
                



I tried one of the original labs handles with the heavier base kind of looked a little bit cooler than the standard one and I liked it I did notice that they didn't have one with the vibration mode I added this one to my cart once I saw the heating which I thought was a nifty niche thing and when they lowered the price for a prime day I'd completely jumped on it I have to say that I know you're thinking why would I need it to warm itself if I'm ultimately going to rinse it in hot water and it warms up the blades anyway cuz that's what I said this is all true and it does have still happen however if you shaved for many years like I have you noticed that after a couple of swipes with the water making the blades hot it completely wears off this thing keeps going and I say it is definitely notable I left mine on the highest setting it didn't get to the point where I needed to feel like I needed to lower it so it was a good heat on the high mode I don't think I'll ever be going down from there it does work great so far and if I come to a point where I don't feel the same way I will come and update this cuz I'm very intimate about razors and this one seems pretty good so far I am going to miss the vibration mode that the older versions had I wish it could incorporate both the heating and the vibration into one now that would be cool but I think I'd rather the heat over the vibration which is weird I didn't think I would.

review_list.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
An honest review here…
review_list.body: So I’m 48, and I’ve used everything from different electric razors/shavers, to straight edge, to disposable, two blade, three, four, five etc.I tend to stick with Gillette products even though I know you pay a premium for them. I was hesitant to try this razor but not at that exorbitant price of $200+! I waited til it came down to $112,(although it’s probably worth no more than $50 tops.) I will say it’s really easy to use, charge, and switch temperatures on the blade.I used it for the first time in my shower, with shave cream, and got a really nice, smooth shave with zero irritation. The warm blade felt nice against the skin. Now, I’ve read plenty of comments of “why not just run your razor under hot water instead?” Go ahead, and you’ll have to do that over and over again! It’s not going to continuously give the same feeling as the heated bar below the razor.Now, am I looking forward to paying a premium for replacement blades, no. Here’s the thing though, I can stretch the life span out because I have different razors, and a few electric ones. I like to switch it up from time to time lol!Bottom line is it’s not as bad as all the whiny reviews I’ve read, but it’s not for everyone either. It would be better priced around $50, but so far I do like it. You be the judge.Update: I’m one month into using this razor now, 6 or 7 shaves all in the shower. Before I had to thoroughly wet my face with hot water to keep from the razor tugging my hair as I shave, but not with this razor. As soon as I apply shave cream and turn the heating element on, I’m shaving tug free within 3-4 seconds. The heating element feels nice against the skin, and I really do get a nice, smooth shave. The top blue strip on the razor blade is starting to wear away some, but I’m still getting a good shave from the initial blade.Will update again if things change.UPDATE 2:Razor handle quit charging on 4-18, not even 6 months into using it.I contacted Gillette via the chat feature on their webpage, had to provide proof of purchase through Amazon, and a few days later received a new kit in the mail.The short life of the charging handle does worry me some, but at least Gillette stood behind their product, and gave me a hassle free replacement.Will update again if need be.

review_list.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
An honest review here…
review_list.body: So I’m 48, and I’ve used everything from different electric razors/shavers, to straight edge, to disposable, two blade, three, four, five etc.I tend to stick with Gillette products even though I know you pay a premium for them. I was hesitant to try this razor but not at that exorbitant price of $200+! I waited til it came down to $112,(although it’s probably worth no more than $50 tops.) I will say it’s really easy to use, charge, and switch temperatures on the blade.I used it for the first time in my shower, with shave cream, and got a really nice, smooth shave with zero irritation. The warm blade felt nice against the skin. Now, I’ve read plenty of comments of “why not just run your razor under hot water instead?” Go ahead, and you’ll have to do that over and over again! It’s not going to continuously give the same feeling as the heated bar below the razor.Now, am I looking forward to paying a premium for replacement blades, no. Here’s the thing though, I can stretch the life span out because I have different razors, and a few electric ones. I like to switch it up from time to time lol!Bottom line is it’s not as bad as all the whiny reviews I’ve read, but it’s not for everyone either. It would be better priced around $50, but so far I do like it. You be the judge.Update: I’m one month into using this razor now, 6 or 7 shaves all in the shower. Before I had to thoroughly wet my face with hot water to keep from the razor tugging my hair as I shave, but not with this razor. As soon as I apply shave cream and turn the heating element on, I’m shaving tug free within 3-4 seconds. The heating element feels nice against the skin, and I really do get a nice, smooth shave. The top blue strip on the razor blade is starting to wear away some, but I’m still getting a good shave from the initial blade.Will update again if things change.UPDATE 2:Razor handle quit charging on 4-18, not even 6 months into using it.I contacted Gillette via the chat feature on their webpage, had to provide proof of purchase through Amazon, and a few days later received a new kit in the mail.The short life of the charging handle does worry me some, but at least Gillette stood behind their product, and gave me a hassle free replacement.Will update again if need be.

review_list.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
An honest review here…
review_list.body: So I’m 48, and I’ve used everything from different electric razors/shavers, to straight edge, to disposable, two blade, three, four, five etc.I tend to stick with Gillette products even though I know you pay a premium for them. I was hesitant to try this razor but not at that exorbitant price of $200+! I waited til it came down to $112,(although it’s probably worth no more than $50 tops.) I will say it’s really easy to use, charge, and switch temperatures on the blade.I used it for the first time in my shower, with shave cream, and got a really nice, smooth shave with zero irritation. The warm blade felt nice against the skin. Now, I’ve read plenty of comments of “why not just run your razor under hot water instead?” Go ahead, and you’ll have to do that over and over again! It’s not going to continuously give the same feeling as the heated bar below the razor.Now, am I looking forward to paying a premium for replacement blades, no. Here’s the thing though, I can stretch the life span out because I have different razors, and a few electric ones. I like to switch it up from time to time lol!Bottom line is it’s not as bad as all the whiny reviews I’ve read, but it’s not for everyone either. It would be better priced around $50, but so far I do like it. You be the judge.Update: I’m one month into using this razor now, 6 or 7 shaves all in the shower. Before I had to thoroughly wet my face with hot water to keep from the razor tugging my hair as I shave, but not with this razor. As soon as I apply shave cream and turn the heating element on, I’m shaving tug free within 3-4 seconds. The heating element feels nice against the skin, and I really do get a nice, smooth shave. The top blue strip on the razor blade is starting to wear away some, but I’m still getting a good shave from the initial blade.Will update again if things change.UPDATE 2:Razor handle quit charging on 4-18, not even 6 months into using it.I contacted Gillette via the chat feature on their webpage, had to provide proof of purchase through Amazon, and a few days later received a new kit in the mail.The short life of the charging handle does worry me some, but at least Gillette stood behind their product, and gave me a hassle free replacement.Will update again if need be.

Sinfully hedonistic, hopefully it lasts both in terms of its effects on the shaving experience and its durability, and availability of consumables at least on here, pricey as they might be.

review_list.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Great Razor but there are Issues
review_list.body: I love the shave with the heat.  The blades are surgically sharp for the first 4 or 5 uses.  They drop down a little in sharpness but then seem to stay at that level for months so you can either change them every week or two to three times per year.  Now the problem.  I've had 4 of these.  With daily use the battery fails after 13 or 14 months.  Gillette will not offer an exchange or sell you just the razor without the expensive packaging and charger.  They may offer a slight discount but it's the same as their occasional sale price.  This applies to both the Bugatti edition and the regular.  No one appears to have figured out how to open the handle to change the battery.  I have 3 failed units.  I tried heat and solvent to open the first one with no luck.  Next I'm going to try to saw one open.Gillette needs to either fix their charge circuit that is destroying the battery or offer to exchange the razor at some reasonable cost, maybe $45 after the 12 month warranty.

para afeitarse la cara,la nariz y el cuello o zonas pequeñas(intimas como: axilas,pene/vagina,ano/el culo,) o los pelos de las manos/pies, aunque repito,no esta hecha para afeitarte todo el cuerpo y si quieres afeitarte apenas las zonas pequeñas la duracion te puede jugar en contra(por eso personalmente digo que esta hecha solo para la cara), recomendaria comprar la gillette labs con exfoliante ya que no te tienes que preocupar por la bateria,el exfoliante ayuda a eliminar las celulas muertas,hay mas ediciones limitadas que podrian gustarte,es reciclable y bueno con el medio ambiente(ya depende de ti botar la afeitadora cuando se acabe el exfoliante) si no quieres gastar tu dinero y estas limitado o te afeitas zonas pequeñas como mencione antes, con una afeitadora de cartucho y el resto del cuerpo con una electrica, entonces comprate la heathed razor, tambien puedes si vives en un clima frio, si como dije estas limitado de dinero,te gusta utilizar una afeitadora de cartucho para todo o quieres cuidar mas o menos el medio ambiente sin gastar en tecnologia que puede no utilices y gastes el doble de tu dinero comprando, y en materiales tecnologicos utiles para otras cosas que puede y terminen en la basura entonces comprate la de exfoliante, lo mejor que tiene gillette,con algo que es bueno con el ambiente,si eres de los que quieren afeitarse la cabeza puede que te sirva la heathed razor aunque te recomendaria utilizar una maquina electrica, bueno... como dije ya depende de ti que quieres y como quieres sacar provecho del producto(aunque, mi recomendacion es que pienses bien y sepas comprar inteligentemente ante todo lo que tus necesidades necesitan)PD: gracias por leer y perdon por hacerlos leer mucho,no se hacer reseñas y trato de explicar lo mejor que puedo para todo tipo de personas que lo lean, espero les haya servido...

review_list.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
It is okay.
review_list.body: The Gillette Heated Razor is the definition of not really worth it. The price is way off, doesn't really get too hot (understandably), and a little bit clunky compared to other razors. The cool thing about it is that it has a magnetic stand that charges the razor and the look of the razor is really cool. To know that it heats up and gives you a warm fuzzy feeling inside is not really justifiable since overall it is really just a regular razor with a heating strip. The same razor without the heating strip, but exfoliating bar is on sale now and is worth the price more than this one. I still get razor bumps even while using the thickest shaving cream I could find, and yeah just not worth it.

The biggest problem is that the battery doesn’t hold charge at all, fully charge the blade holder and the stand which also hold charge to charge the blade after each use but both batteries fully charged and just let them sit for a week and no charge!!! So beside it’s look and design  it doesn’t really deliver a better warm shaving, at this price it’s unacceptable ( regular ones are much cheaper but you just pay 35%ish more to get the Bugatti,It doesn’t provide a warm smoother experience but if you’re slow it’ll burn your face ( yes it gets a little too hot not warm, quality design look everything excellent, Battery always 🪫, even a 🔋 fully charged battery will die in a week or so JUST SITTING NOT USE IT, and battery won’t hold charge. Not a good thing when you pay hundreds extra to get a unique shaving experience then you find out it wasn’t what you were expecting.Second appointment

review_list.title:
2.0 out of 5 stars
It’s excellent in design and materials on exterior. It’s just doesn’t work well!
review_list.body: Beautiful design and packaging high quality materials that you can feel it in your hand when you hold it or use it. The biggest problem is that the battery doesn’t hold charge at all, fully charge the blade holder and the stand which also hold charge to charge the blade after each use but both batteries fully charged and just let them sit for a week and no charge!!! So beside it’s look and design  it doesn’t really deliver a better warm shaving, at this price it’s unacceptable ( regular ones are much cheaper but you just pay 35%ish more to get the Bugatti,It doesn’t provide a warm smoother experience but if you’re slow it’ll burn your face ( yes it gets a little too hot not warm, quality design look everything excellent, Battery always 🪫, even a 🔋 fully charged battery will die in a week or so JUST SITTING NOT USE IT, and battery won’t hold charge. Not a good thing when you pay hundreds extra to get a unique shaving experience then you find out it wasn’t what you were expecting.Second appointment

1.0 out of 5 stars
Quit Charging After 4 Months
review_list.body: This razor was great, preformed as described. I used it daily, however, noticed over the past few weeks that the charge wasn’t holding. Yesterday, it would not charge at all. The base lights up when you place the razor in the stand, however, does not continue charging. When you turn the heat feature on, the razor blinks orange rapidly, however, it does not stay on. We tried multiple electrical outlets to ensure there was power. This was an expensive razor for 4 months use, not including the blades. Unless Gillette rectifies this, I would strongly encourage others not to purchase this. I am only now reading that other consumers are experiencing the same issue.

Can not see any improvement. The shave though is good with a new blade replacement however for some reason these blades don't last long as the older 5 blade systems.BTW, replacing/attaching a new blade attachment is difficult to find the correct angle to attach to the handle even though I've tried over several months when required. review_list.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Warning ! Don't buy this product !!
review_list.body: Two years ago, in November 2021, I got a “Bugatti” Gillette heated razor for my birthday from my son. I was very pleased with the device, but unfortunately the device battery system failed in June 2022, after using it for only 6 months.Since this was within the warranty so Gillette was kind enough to send me a replacement immediately. Much to my disappointment this device had the same problem after 10 months, again within the warranty of the replacement device.Gillette was very kind to again immediately send a replacement. Regrettably, this replacement device’s battery was “dead on arrival”. I was requested to send the defect devices to the Gillette Repair center. Supposedly to verify that the devices were indeed defect. I received again new device in August 2023. But today, December 15 2023, the razor failed again after only 5 months.So that were 4 defect devices in two years. Obviously, Gillette has some serious quality problems. Please don’t buy this product, you will be very disappointed.

review_list.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Heat expands molecules = Bad for blades
review_list.body: So, this is a really bad idea for a blade. Simple chemistry would inform anyone why that is a bad idea. Heat expands the molecules so the blade would be less sharp. You want the hairs on your face to be soft and heated and use a cold blade. For example, when sharpening my chef knife, I use cold water on my whetstone so the molecules contract in the stone and become stronger while I put my chef knife under extremely hot water. Once the blade is sharp, I run the chef knife under cold water for a sharper blade. Heating the blade itself will make the blade less sharp. If you want a close shave, use a heated towel on your face, shaving cream, and a very cold blade for the best results. I feel like Gillette should know these basic concepts to the art of shaving.

At least the price came down from $200.  But really just get the same razor with the green bar on it for $25 to $35.  And Walmart and Target as well as most pharmacies sells the replacement heads.

Plus the recharge time is long, so you never actually use the razor with the heated function the entire time. Stick to the Gillette Power as it provides a similar shave without the recharge issue.

review_list.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
eciN
review_list.body:
The media could not be loaded.
                



I tried one of the original labs handles with the heavier base kind of looked a little bit cooler than the standard one and I liked it I did notice that they didn't have one with the vibration mode I added this one to my cart once I saw the heating which I thought was a nifty niche thing and when they lowered the price for a prime day I'd completely jumped on it I have to say that I know you're thinking why would I need it to warm itself if I'm ultimately going to rinse it in hot water and it warms up the blades anyway cuz that's what I said this is all true and it does have still happen however if you shaved for many years like I have you noticed that after a couple of swipes with the water making the blades hot it completely wears off this thing keeps going and I say it is definitely notable I left mine on the highest setting it didn't get to the point where I needed to feel like I needed to lower it so it was a good heat on the high mode I don't think I'll ever be going down from there it does work great so far and if I come to a point where I don't feel the same way I will come and update this cuz I'm very intimate about razors and this one seems pretty good so far I am going to miss the vibration mode that the older versions had I wish it could incorporate both the heating and the vibration into one now that would be cool but I think I'd rather the heat over the vibration which is weird I didn't think I would.

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
true hot towel like shave! Best shave ever, and I am old as dirt.
review_list.body: Absolutely the best shave out there. I am very pleased with this hot shavor.

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
The heat bar is a game changer!
review_list.body: The razor holds a good charge over a long period of time. The system provides a well heated warming bar right before the razor to allow for a closer, cleaner shave. This is my second heated razor (this time I went with the Bugatti for fun), and they both work wonderfully. Complete with a charging stand and optional charging case for when you travel.

review_list.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
An honest review here…
review_list.body: So I’m 48, and I’ve used everything from different electric razors/shavers, to straight edge, to disposable, two blade, three, four, five etc.I tend to stick with Gillette products even though I know you pay a premium for them. I was hesitant to try this razor but not at that exorbitant price of $200+! I waited til it came down to $112,(although it’s probably worth no more than $50 tops.) I will say it’s really easy to use, charge, and switch temperatures on the blade.I used it for the first time in my shower, with shave cream, and got a really nice, smooth shave with zero irritation. The warm blade felt nice against the skin. Now, I’ve read plenty of comments of “why not just run your razor under hot water instead?” Go ahead, and you’ll have to do that over and over again! It’s not going to continuously give the same feeling as the heated bar below the razor.Now, am I looking forward to paying a premium for replacement blades, no. Here’s the thing though, I can stretch the life span out because I have different razors, and a few electric ones. I like to switch it up from time to time lol!Bottom line is it’s not as bad as all the whiny reviews I’ve read, but it’s not for everyone either. It would be better priced around $50, but so far I do like it. You be the judge.Update: I’m one month into using this razor now, 6 or 7 shaves all in the shower. Before I had to thoroughly wet my face with hot water to keep from the razor tugging my hair as I shave, but not with this razor. As soon as I apply shave cream and turn the heating element on, I’m shaving tug free within 3-4 seconds. The heating element feels nice against the skin, and I really do get a nice, smooth shave. The top blue strip on the razor blade is starting to wear away some, but I’m still getting a good shave from the initial blade.Will update again if things change.UPDATE 2:Razor handle quit charging on 4-18, not even 6 months into using it.I contacted Gillette via the chat feature on their webpage, had to provide proof of purchase through Amazon, and a few days later received a new kit in the mail.The short life of the charging handle does worry me some, but at least Gillette stood behind their product, and gave me a hassle free replacement.Will update again if need be.

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Worth the price
review_list.body: This is the first personal care item I have ever bought where I felt I splurged on myself.  I read about the Gillette Labs razor and heard how good it was, and then stumbled across the heated razor I could get as well.  It was expensive, but I waited and before Black Friday it went on sale with a big price drop.  Even so, it was about six times more expensive than the ordinary Gillette razors.I usually shave in the shower using women's shave oil, which you can find online or in a big box store (the women's oils have many different smells and the bottle is significantly bigger than the oil drops I used to use).  I wait until I have been in there a bit and my face warms up, and then the shave is smooth and easy.  This razor claims to heat your face like they do when you get a barbershop shave, but they say a lot.  I started working out and wanted to shave, but not shower at home until after my workout, which meant shaving with a cold face, and trying to warm up the blade in a sink of hot water.I used this new razor this morning.  It was set to the hottest setting and holy buckets, the shave was amazingly comfortable.  It heats in less than one second and it gets warm.  It really does feel like a hot towel barber shave and I thought I got just as good a shave, if not better because it felt luxurious, than the other Gillette I use in the shower.  It is amazing.  This razor was well worth the money I spent on it.  The only down-side is that I probably wont be able to buy the blade refills at my local big box membership store.  Alas.

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
A Luxury Shave If You Can Factor In a Total Replacement Every 2-3 Years
review_list.body: TL;DR: The Gillette Labs Heated Razor Gold Edition isn't a gimmick. It's a meticulously engineered shaving experience that leverages thermodynamics to deliver an unparalleled shave. But at a premium price, you can expect the razor to last 2-3 years before needing a total replacement.First Impressions: The Gold Edition oozes luxury. The weighty, gold-trimmed handle feels substantial, while the inductive charging dock screams sophistication. But the true star is the heated blade cartridge. Gillette's micro-heater tech raises the temperature to a precise 122°F in 0.5 seconds.The Shave: Ah, the shave itself. It's like a warm hug on your face. The heated blade glides effortlessly, prepping hair for the five-blade onslaught. Gone are the days of pre-shave oil—the warmth acts as a lubricant, minimizing friction and irritation. The result? It was a shockingly close shave with minimal razor burn, even on my notoriously sensitive skin.Tech Talk: This razor is a marvel of miniaturization. The lithium-ion battery tucked within the handle powers the heater for up to six shaves while the temperature sensors constantly monitor and adjust heat output for optimal comfort and safety.But it could be better. The hefty price tag might sting, and the proprietary blade cartridges add to the long-term cost. Plus, the temperature range is limited, and some might miss the ritual of a hot shower shave.Verdict: The Gillette Labs Heated Razor Gold Edition is a game-changer. It's not just a razor; it's an investment in a luxurious, comfortable, and technically impressive shaving experience.

When I opened the box and looked at the Bugatti, I thought that it would nick my face like crazy. Anyway I lathered up and began shaving. Oh boy!  Was I surprised at how smooth and nick free of a shave I got from it. This is my number one favorite razor to go to. review_list.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
An honest review here…
review_list.body: So I’m 48, and I’ve used everything from different electric razors/shavers, to straight edge, to disposable, two blade, three, four, five etc.I tend to stick with Gillette products even though I know you pay a premium for them. I was hesitant to try this razor but not at that exorbitant price of $200+! I waited til it came down to $112,(although it’s probably worth no more than $50 tops.) I will say it’s really easy to use, charge, and switch temperatures on the blade.I used it for the first time in my shower, with shave cream, and got a really nice, smooth shave with zero irritation. The warm blade felt nice against the skin. Now, I’ve read plenty of comments of “why not just run your razor under hot water instead?” Go ahead, and you’ll have to do that over and over again! It’s not going to continuously give the same feeling as the heated bar below the razor.Now, am I looking forward to paying a premium for replacement blades, no. Here’s the thing though, I can stretch the life span out because I have different razors, and a few electric ones. I like to switch it up from time to time lol!Bottom line is it’s not as bad as all the whiny reviews I’ve read, but it’s not for everyone either. It would be better priced around $50, but so far I do like it. You be the judge.Update: I’m one month into using this razor now, 6 or 7 shaves all in the shower. Before I had to thoroughly wet my face with hot water to keep from the razor tugging my hair as I shave, but not with this razor. As soon as I apply shave cream and turn the heating element on, I’m shaving tug free within 3-4 seconds. The heating element feels nice against the skin, and I really do get a nice, smooth shave. The top blue strip on the razor blade is starting to wear away some, but I’m still getting a good shave from the initial blade.Will update again if things change.UPDATE 2:Razor handle quit charging on 4-18, not even 6 months into using it.I contacted Gillette via the chat feature on their webpage, had to provide proof of purchase through Amazon, and a few days later received a new kit in the mail.The short life of the charging handle does worry me some, but at least Gillette stood behind their product, and gave me a hassle free replacement.Will update again if need be.

I have used many razors in my time, actually spending more on certain brands than this one, but I have to tell you, this was the most comfortable, accurate, smooth shave that I have ever had. I was astonished and greatly impressed. The razor cut through my 4 day beard like butter. The absolute closest, comfortable and easiest shave I have ever had. The price may be a little high for some but to get an excellent comfortable shave is worth every penny. Refills are a little pricey but if I can get 10 shaves with each blade, this is a home run for me. I would have liked a little hotter heat strip but that's just me.  THIS IS A WINNER IN MY BOOK !

review_list.body: As a man who loves a good shave, I was excited to try out the Gillette Heated Razor for Men, Bugatti Limited Edition Shave Kit by GilletteLabs. Let me tell you, this thing is a game changer!First of all, the heated razor feels like a hot towel is being draped over your face, making for a luxurious shaving experience. It's like a spa day in your own bathroom! The razor is designed with the same attention to detail as a Bugatti car, and I feel like I'm driving a luxury vehicle on my face.The shave itself is smooth and effortless, thanks to the five blades that effortlessly glide over your skin. The razor even has a FlexDisc technology which adapts to the contours of your face, ensuring a comfortable and close shave every time.The only downside is that my wife keeps trying to steal it for herself! I guess it's not just for men after all.The Bugatti Limited Edition Shave Kit comes with everything you need for the perfect shave, including a magnetic charging dock, a travel case, and even a premium shaving cream. It's the ultimate shaving kit for the man who wants to look and feel his best.Overall, I would highly recommend the Gillette Heated Razor for Men, Bugatti Limited Edition Shave Kit by GilletteLabs to any man (or woman!) who wants to elevate their shaving experience to the next level. It's like having a spa day in your own bathroom, and who doesn't want that?

review_list.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
An honest review here…
review_list.body: So I’m 48, and I’ve used everything from different electric razors/shavers, to straight edge, to disposable, two blade, three, four, five etc.I tend to stick with Gillette products even though I know you pay a premium for them. I was hesitant to try this razor but not at that exorbitant price of $200+! I waited til it came down to $112,(although it’s probably worth no more than $50 tops.) I will say it’s really easy to use, charge, and switch temperatures on the blade.I used it for the first time in my shower, with shave cream, and got a really nice, smooth shave with zero irritation. The warm blade felt nice against the skin. Now, I’ve read plenty of comments of “why not just run your razor under hot water instead?” Go ahead, and you’ll have to do that over and over again! It’s not going to continuously give the same feeling as the heated bar below the razor.Now, am I looking forward to paying a premium for replacement blades, no. Here’s the thing though, I can stretch the life span out because I have different razors, and a few electric ones. I like to switch it up from time to time lol!Bottom line is it’s not as bad as all the whiny reviews I’ve read, but it’s not for everyone either. It would be better priced around $50, but so far I do like it. You be the judge.Update: I’m one month into using this razor now, 6 or 7 shaves all in the shower. Before I had to thoroughly wet my face with hot water to keep from the razor tugging my hair as I shave, but not with this razor. As soon as I apply shave cream and turn the heating element on, I’m shaving tug free within 3-4 seconds. The heating element feels nice against the skin, and I really do get a nice, smooth shave. The top blue strip on the razor blade is starting to wear away some, but I’m still getting a good shave from the initial blade.Will update again if things change.UPDATE 2:Razor handle quit charging on 4-18, not even 6 months into using it.I contacted Gillette via the chat feature on their webpage, had to provide proof of purchase through Amazon, and a few days later received a new kit in the mail.The short life of the charging handle does worry me some, but at least Gillette stood behind their product, and gave me a hassle free replacement.Will update again if need be.

review_list.body: So awesome

review_list.title: Good product

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Worth the price
review_list.body: This is the first personal care item I have ever bought where I felt I splurged on myself.  I read about the Gillette Labs razor and heard how good it was, and then stumbled across the heated razor I could get as well.  It was expensive, but I waited and before Black Friday it went on sale with a big price drop.  Even so, it was about six times more expensive than the ordinary Gillette razors.I usually shave in the shower using women's shave oil, which you can find online or in a big box store (the women's oils have many different smells and the bottle is significantly bigger than the oil drops I used to use).  I wait until I have been in there a bit and my face warms up, and then the shave is smooth and easy.  This razor claims to heat your face like they do when you get a barbershop shave, but they say a lot.  I started working out and wanted to shave, but not shower at home until after my workout, which meant shaving with a cold face, and trying to warm up the blade in a sink of hot water.I used this new razor this morning.  It was set to the hottest setting and holy buckets, the shave was amazingly comfortable.  It heats in less than one second and it gets warm.  It really does feel like a hot towel barber shave and I thought I got just as good a shave, if not better because it felt luxurious, than the other Gillette I use in the shower.  It is amazing.  This razor was well worth the money I spent on it.  The only down-side is that I probably wont be able to buy the blade refills at my local big box membership store.  Alas.

review_list.title:

review_list.body: I heard about the Bugatti Gellette razor and was intrigued about it. I was using one of my Gellette Adjustable Black Beauty razors that would give me a nick or two while shaving. I have a sensitive face and tough beard. I was trying different razors to find one that was good for my face. When I opened the box and looked at the Bugatti, I thought that it would nick my face like crazy. Anyway I lathered up and began shaving. Oh boy!  Was I surprised at how smooth and nick free of a shave I got from it. This is my number one favorite razor to go to. Thank you Amazon, and thank you Gillette for finally inventing a razor that shaves without giving your face nicks

I am semi retired and usually shave every other day but It was 4 days since my last shave, with more stubble so I was a little hesitant about it's ability. I lathered up and used the razor. I have used many razors in my time, actually spending more on certain brands than this one, but I have to tell you, this was the most comfortable, accurate, smooth shave that I have ever had. I was astonished and greatly impressed. The razor cut through my 4 day beard like butter. The absolute closest, comfortable and easiest shave I have ever had. The price may be a little high for some but to get an excellent comfortable shave is worth every penny. Refills are a little pricey but if I can get 10 shaves with each blade, this is a home run for me. I would have liked a little hotter heat strip but that's just me.  THIS IS A WINNER IN MY BOOK !

review_list.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
The heated razor keeps my face extra smooth!
review_list.body: As a man who loves a good shave, I was excited to try out the Gillette Heated Razor for Men, Bugatti Limited Edition Shave Kit by GilletteLabs. Let me tell you, this thing is a game changer!First of all, the heated razor feels like a hot towel is being draped over your face, making for a luxurious shaving experience. It's like a spa day in your own bathroom! The razor is designed with the same attention to detail as a Bugatti car, and I feel like I'm driving a luxury vehicle on my face.The shave itself is smooth and effortless, thanks to the five blades that effortlessly glide over your skin. The razor even has a FlexDisc technology which adapts to the contours of your face, ensuring a comfortable and close shave every time.The only downside is that my wife keeps trying to steal it for herself! I guess it's not just for men after all.The Bugatti Limited Edition Shave Kit comes with everything you need for the perfect shave, including a magnetic charging dock, a travel case, and even a premium shaving cream. It's the ultimate shaving kit for the man who wants to look and feel his best.Overall, I would highly recommend the Gillette Heated Razor for Men, Bugatti Limited Edition Shave Kit by GilletteLabs to any man (or woman!) who wants to elevate their shaving experience to the next level. It's like having a spa day in your own bathroom, and who doesn't want that?
