review_list.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Great Razor but there are Issues
review_list.body: I love the shave with the heat.  The blades are surgically sharp for the first 4 or 5 uses.  They drop down a little in sharpness but then seem to stay at that level for months so you can either change them every week or two to three times per year.  Now the problem.  I've had 4 of these.  With daily use the battery fails after 13 or 14 months.  Gillette will not offer an exchange or sell you just the razor without the expensive packaging and charger.  They may offer a slight discount but it's the same as their occasional sale price.  This applies to both the Bugatti edition and the regular.  No one appears to have figured out how to open the handle to change the battery.  I have 3 failed units.  I tried heat and solvent to open the first one with no luck.  Next I'm going to try to saw one open.Gillette needs to either fix their charge circuit that is destroying the battery or offer to exchange the razor at some reasonable cost, maybe $45 after the 12 month warranty.

review_list.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
bonito,poca duracion,precio alto,temperatura insatisfactoria,baja lubricacion,cuchillas afiladas
review_list.body: pensaba en alta expectativa este producto,ya que es el producto mas avanzado de gillette,pero la durabilidad de el calentado no dura mucho tiempo,principalmente porque yo lo utilizo para afeitarme el cuerpo una vez al mes(a final de mes,el fin de semana, viernes o sabado,o la semana antes de terminar dicho mes,dependiendo el mes)bueno...el caso es que el precio en mi pais es considerado muy alto por el cambio de Dolares a COP,la lubricacion se gasto al primer uso,la temperatura en alto me parece poco satisfactorio aunque si eligieron hasta esa temperatura para cuidar la piel no me quejo,la cuchillas son afiladas puede que mas suaves que la gillette 5 hojas con flexball(ya que este me cortaba, en vambio este modelo no)el diseño es bonito,mi recomendacion: yo personalmente lo dejaria en mi coleccion de afeitadoras gillette de 5 hojas o 7 hojas(dorco),o lo podrias regalar a alguien que si lo necesite,ya que es una afeitadora que sirve y dura lo suficiente para afeitarse la cara,la nariz y el cuello o zonas pequeñas(intimas como: axilas,pene/vagina,ano/el culo,) o los pelos de las manos/pies, aunque repito,no esta hecha para afeitarte todo el cuerpo y si quieres afeitarte apenas las zonas pequeñas la duracion te puede jugar en contra(por eso personalmente digo que esta hecha solo para la cara), recomendaria comprar la gillette labs con exfoliante ya que no te tienes que preocupar por la bateria,el exfoliante ayuda a eliminar las celulas muertas,hay mas ediciones limitadas que podrian gustarte,es reciclable y bueno con el medio ambiente(ya depende de ti botar la afeitadora cuando se acabe el exfoliante) si no quieres gastar tu dinero y estas limitado o te afeitas zonas pequeñas como mencione antes, con una afeitadora de cartucho y el resto del cuerpo con una electrica, entonces comprate la heathed razor, tambien puedes si vives en un clima frio, si como dije estas limitado de dinero,te gusta utilizar una afeitadora de cartucho para todo o quieres cuidar mas o menos el medio ambiente sin gastar en tecnologia que puede no utilices y gastes el doble de tu dinero comprando, y en materiales tecnologicos utiles para otras cosas que puede y terminen en la basura entonces comprate la de exfoliante, lo mejor que tiene gillette,con algo que es bueno con el ambiente,si eres de los que quieren afeitarse la cabeza puede que te sirva la heathed razor aunque te recomendaria utilizar una maquina electrica, bueno... como dije ya depende de ti que quieres y como quieres sacar provecho del producto(aunque, mi recomendacion es que pienses bien y sepas comprar inteligentemente ante todo lo que tus necesidades necesitan)PD: gracias por leer y perdon por hacerlos leer mucho,no se hacer reseñas y trato de explicar lo mejor que puedo para todo tipo de personas que lo lean, espero les haya servido...

Warning ! Don't buy this product !!
review_list.body: Two years ago, in November 2021, I got a “Bugatti” Gillette heated razor for my birthday from my son. I was very pleased with the device, but unfortunately the device battery system failed in June 2022, after using it for only 6 months.Since this was within the warranty so Gillette was kind enough to send me a replacement immediately. Much to my disappointment this device had the same problem after 10 months, again within the warranty of the replacement device.Gillette was very kind to again immediately send a replacement. Regrettably, this replacement device’s battery was “dead on arrival”. I was requested to send the defect devices to the Gillette Repair center. Supposedly to verify that the devices were indeed defect. I received again new device in August 2023. But today, December 15 2023, the razor failed again after only 5 months.So that were 4 defect devices in two years. Obviously, Gillette has some serious quality problems. Please don’t buy this product, you will be very disappointed.

review_list.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Heat expands molecules = Bad for blades
review_list.body: So, this is a really bad idea for a blade. Simple chemistry would inform anyone why that is a bad idea. Heat expands the molecules so the blade would be less sharp. You want the hairs on your face to be soft and heated and use a cold blade. For example, when sharpening my chef knife, I use cold water on my whetstone so the molecules contract in the stone and become stronger while I put my chef knife under extremely hot water. Once the blade is sharp, I run the chef knife under cold water for a sharper blade. Heating the blade itself will make the blade less sharp. If you want a close shave, use a heated towel on your face, shaving cream, and a very cold blade for the best results. I feel like Gillette should know these basic concepts to the art of shaving.

Plus the recharge time is long, so you never actually use the razor with the heated function the entire time. Stick to the Gillette Power as it provides a similar shave without the recharge issue.

review_list.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Great Razor but there are Issues
review_list.body: I love the shave with the heat.  The blades are surgically sharp for the first 4 or 5 uses.  They drop down a little in sharpness but then seem to stay at that level for months so you can either change them every week or two to three times per year.  Now the problem.  I've had 4 of these.  With daily use the battery fails after 13 or 14 months.  Gillette will not offer an exchange or sell you just the razor without the expensive packaging and charger.  They may offer a slight discount but it's the same as their occasional sale price.  This applies to both the Bugatti edition and the regular.  No one appears to have figured out how to open the handle to change the battery.  I have 3 failed units.  I tried heat and solvent to open the first one with no luck.  Next I'm going to try to saw one open.Gillette needs to either fix their charge circuit that is destroying the battery or offer to exchange the razor at some reasonable cost, maybe $45 after the 12 month warranty.

review_list.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
bonito,poca duracion,precio alto,temperatura insatisfactoria,baja lubricacion,cuchillas afiladas
review_list.body: pensaba en alta expectativa este producto,ya que es el producto mas avanzado de gillette,pero la durabilidad de el calentado no dura mucho tiempo,principalmente porque yo lo utilizo para afeitarme el cuerpo una vez al mes(a final de mes,el fin de semana, viernes o sabado,o la semana antes de terminar dicho mes,dependiendo el mes)bueno...el caso es que el precio en mi pais es considerado muy alto por el cambio de Dolares a COP,la lubricacion se gasto al primer uso,la temperatura en alto me parece poco satisfactorio aunque si eligieron hasta esa temperatura para cuidar la piel no me quejo,la cuchillas son afiladas puede que mas suaves que la gillette 5 hojas con flexball(ya que este me cortaba, en vambio este modelo no)el diseño es bonito,mi recomendacion: yo personalmente lo dejaria en mi coleccion de afeitadoras gillette de 5 hojas o 7 hojas(dorco),o lo podrias regalar a alguien que si lo necesite,ya que es una afeitadora que sirve y dura lo suficiente para afeitarse la cara,la nariz y el cuello o zonas pequeñas(intimas como: axilas,pene/vagina,ano/el culo,) o los pelos de las manos/pies, aunque repito,no esta hecha para afeitarte todo el cuerpo y si quieres afeitarte apenas las zonas pequeñas la duracion te puede jugar en contra(por eso personalmente digo que esta hecha solo para la cara), recomendaria comprar la gillette labs con exfoliante ya que no te tienes que preocupar por la bateria,el exfoliante ayuda a eliminar las celulas muertas,hay mas ediciones limitadas que podrian gustarte,es reciclable y bueno con el medio ambiente(ya depende de ti botar la afeitadora cuando se acabe el exfoliante) si no quieres gastar tu dinero y estas limitado o te afeitas zonas pequeñas como mencione antes, con una afeitadora de cartucho y el resto del cuerpo con una electrica, entonces comprate la heathed razor, tambien puedes si vives en un clima frio, si como dije estas limitado de dinero,te gusta utilizar una afeitadora de cartucho para todo o quieres cuidar mas o menos el medio ambiente sin gastar en tecnologia que puede no utilices y gastes el doble de tu dinero comprando, y en materiales tecnologicos utiles para otras cosas que puede y terminen en la basura entonces comprate la de exfoliante, lo mejor que tiene gillette,con algo que es bueno con el ambiente,si eres de los que quieren afeitarse la cabeza puede que te sirva la heathed razor aunque te recomendaria utilizar una maquina electrica, bueno... como dije ya depende de ti que quieres y como quieres sacar provecho del producto(aunque, mi recomendacion es que pienses bien y sepas comprar inteligentemente ante todo lo que tus necesidades necesitan)PD: gracias por leer y perdon por hacerlos leer mucho,no se hacer reseñas y trato de explicar lo mejor que puedo para todo tipo de personas que lo lean, espero les haya servido...

It is okay.
review_list.body: The Gillette Heated Razor is the definition of not really worth it. The price is way off, doesn't really get too hot (understandably), and a little bit clunky compared to other razors. The cool thing about it is that it has a magnetic stand that charges the razor and the look of the razor is really cool. To know that it heats up and gives you a warm fuzzy feeling inside is not really justifiable since overall it is really just a regular razor with a heating strip. The same razor without the heating strip, but exfoliating bar is on sale now and is worth the price more than this one. I still get razor bumps even while using the thickest shaving cream I could find, and yeah just not worth it.

review_list.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Warning ! Don't buy this product !!
review_list.body: Two years ago, in November 2021, I got a “Bugatti” Gillette heated razor for my birthday from my son. I was very pleased with the device, but unfortunately the device battery system failed in June 2022, after using it for only 6 months.Since this was within the warranty so Gillette was kind enough to send me a replacement immediately. Much to my disappointment this device had the same problem after 10 months, again within the warranty of the replacement device.Gillette was very kind to again immediately send a replacement. Regrettably, this replacement device’s battery was “dead on arrival”. I was requested to send the defect devices to the Gillette Repair center. Supposedly to verify that the devices were indeed defect. I received again new device in August 2023. But today, December 15 2023, the razor failed again after only 5 months.So that were 4 defect devices in two years. Obviously, Gillette has some serious quality problems. Please don’t buy this product, you will be very disappointed.

review_list.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Heat expands molecules = Bad for blades
review_list.body: So, this is a really bad idea for a blade. Simple chemistry would inform anyone why that is a bad idea. Heat expands the molecules so the blade would be less sharp. You want the hairs on your face to be soft and heated and use a cold blade. For example, when sharpening my chef knife, I use cold water on my whetstone so the molecules contract in the stone and become stronger while I put my chef knife under extremely hot water. Once the blade is sharp, I run the chef knife under cold water for a sharper blade. Heating the blade itself will make the blade less sharp. If you want a close shave, use a heated towel on your face, shaving cream, and a very cold blade for the best results. I feel like Gillette should know these basic concepts to the art of shaving.
